title: Does Yasuo really need double crit?
body: If frozen/force and bruiser builds work on him, why not just drop the double crit and make him choose between squishy crit carry and melee duelist?

replies.body: because he is meant to be a squishy melee character that makes use of his kit to survive instead of items. Riot doesn't want his bruiser build to be the way to build him and if you were to remove the double crit then no one would bother building anything but the bruiser build

The problem is, as a melee dps (aka not burst) he needs to build some survivability unless he is insanely ahead. Full damage melee builds have always been the definition of feast or famine.

Yes, Yasuo does have some decent outplay potential in his kit, but the amount of point and click c.c. makes that nearly irrelevant imho.

The issue is that he's a melee carry. Melee carries are just terrible design in the modern game. Yasuo is such a problem because he was Riot's last attempt at making a competitively viable Melee Carry before they gave up and came to the conclusion that the closest thing to a melee carry that can exist and be somewhat healthy are bruisers like {{champion:266}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} or assassins like {{champion:238}} {{champion:91}} . I feel like Riot needs to look at Yasuo, Yi and Tryndamere and decide whether they want them to be mid lase assassins or top/jungle bruisers because  melee carries aren't healthy and are a nightmare to balance.

I don't know why they needed to try to make their own squishy melee carries to realize it doesn't work when DotA has shown that if you're going to make a melee carry then they're going to need to be bulky or really slippery. Melee carries don't get the luxury of attacking from a safer range, so they have to take a hit and that durability can't just intend to come from their kit, like they wanted for their melee ADCs. Bruisers are how you make a melee carry that isn't an assassin.

in league, due to the lack of balance between melee and ranged, a melee carry needs MORE tools like yasuo/fiora/gp/yi to work

I'm convinced he would still be equally strong without it, and it would actually trim down power off the bruiser build as well, which usually includes a phantom dancer.

If they found a way for Ekko and Fizz they'll find for Yasuo too.

Also, I'm not saying that he shouldn't be tanky at all, a more tanky build is welcome if it doesn't make him just better.
I'm sure they will... I just wonder if it would be better for Yasuo if they removed double crit and balanced him around the other power in his kit.
They will never do it, it's the main thematic of his character: crit and mobility.
